decks.notes: This UR aggro deck focuses on efficiently controlling the board and dealing direct damage to the opponent using a mix of counterspells, burn spells, and aggressive creatures. The commanders, Kraum and Ludevic, provide card advantage and further pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a wide variety of cheap instants and creatures to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With an emphasis on instant-speed interaction and flexible threats, this deck aims to quickly close out games while keeping the opponent on the back foot. By leveraging the power of its partner commanders and a well-balanced suite of spells and creatures, this deck seeks to overwhelm opponents in a decisive manner.

The deck revolves around using Lord Windgrace's abilities to control the board and manipulate the graveyard to gain advantage over opponents. With cards like Crucible of Worlds and Life from the Loam, the deck focuses on recurring lands from the graveyard to ensure a steady mana base while also disrupting opponents' resources with cards like Sinkhole and Wasteland. The deck also includes removal spells like Damnation and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, the deck has win conditions like Dark Depths and Primeval Titan to close out the game. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through land manipulation and powerful spells while setting up for a win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own resources. It also includes cards that can generate card advantage like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, as well as versatile spells like Demonic Tutor and Intuition to find key cards when needed. The deck aims to control the board and the opponent's hand, while gradually increasing its own advantage through card advantage and efficient removal. Additionally, the deck includes win conditions like True-Name Nemesis and finishers like Time Warp to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been exhausted.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies and quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells. Kari Zev, Skyship Raider provides a consistent source of damage while the low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear apply pressure early on. The burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Rift Bolt help finish off opponents or deal with threatening creatures. Cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Hell's Thunder provide additional sources of damage, while Blood Moon disrupts opponents' mana bases. Overall, the deck aims to be fast and relentless, pushing the opponent on the back foot and ending the game before they can stabilize.

The deck revolves around using Kess, Dissident Mage to recur powerful spells and control the game through countermagic, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own win conditions through efficient removal, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. The deck is designed to maximize value from instants and sorceries, capitalizing on Kess's ability to cast them from the graveyard. It also includes a range of versatile spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver opponents. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game and grind out incremental advantages until securing a win.

This deck focuses on using the Partner commanders Kraum and Ludevic to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures with evasion and impactful spells to pressure the opponent quickly. Utilizing a combination of tempo plays, disruption, and direct damage, the deck aims to control the board and close out the game before the opponent can fully establish their game plan. With a versatile suite of countermagic, removal, and burn spells, the deck can adapt to different matchups and disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining pressure on the battlefield. By combining aggressive creatures with versatile spells, this deck aims to win through efficient and aggressive plays that capitalize on the Partner commanders' abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a combo utilizing Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander. By generating a large number of tokens through Prossh's ability and other creature spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and utilize various sacrifice outlets like Ashnod's Altar and Goblin Bombardment to deal lethal damage or create infinite combos. The deck also includes various ramp spells and mana accelerants to quickly get Prossh onto the battlefield, as well as disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and execute the win condition through sacrificing creatures and dealing damage.

This aggressive deck utilizes the partner commanders Kraum and Ludevic to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of quick creatures and burn spells. By using cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Young Pyromancer, and Adeliz, the Cinder Wind, along with efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total. Cards like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique provide additional disruption, while powerful card draw spells like Brainstorm and Serum Visions help maintain card advantage. The deck's strategy is to maintain tempo, applying pressure with its efficient threats and controlling the game with its versatile spell suite.
